intro: Hydrocotyle keelungensis, commonly known as Keelung water pennywort, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its creeping growth habit and small, heart-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy environments, often submerged or partially submerged in water. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, round fruits. Hydrocotyle keelungensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
